alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 3:49AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Okmulgee and central Okfuskee Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 349 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Okfuskee to near Okemah. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Okemah... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Morris... Dewar... Schulter... Grayson... Bearden... Hoffman... Clearview... Okmulgee State Park... Pharoah... Bryant... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 214 and 243. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
